speakers.name: Lillian Bellingham
speakers.reknown: Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture
speakers.bio: Lillian has just finished his final year at The Royal Academy of Painting and Sculpture, where she excelled in glass etching paintings and portraiture. Hailed as one of the most diverse artists of his generation, Lillian is equally as skilled with watercolors as he is with oils, and is just as well-balanced in different subject areas. Lillian's collection entitled "The Un-Collection" will adorn the walls of Gilbert Hall, depicting her range of skills and sensibilities - all of them, uniquely Lillian, yet undeniably different

speakers.name: John Louis Brown
speakers.reknown: Recognized Professor at the School of Arts
speakers.bio: John has just finished publishing his studies on the Influence of Arts in High School Education. He graduated with honors from University of World Arts and, since then, has been a strong advocate of inserting Arts Education in the public educational K-12 system. His work has been in different galleries of the country.

speakers.name: Lisa Ferrar
speakers.bio: The Artist to Watch in 2019 by the London Review, Lisa has already sold one of the highest priced-commissions paid to an art student, ever on record. The piece, entitled Gratitude Resort, a work in oil and mixed media, was sold for $750,000 and Lisa donated all the proceeds to Art for Peace, an organization that provides college art scholarships for creative children in developing nations
